definition: double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword

sentences.english: Game, set, match, Crowley and the Cambridge cops.
sentences.chinese: 克羅利和劍橋市警方獲得全勝。

sentences.english: The results of the isotropic model are better than that of modified Cam-clay.
sentences.chinese: 對比計算結果說明各向同性模型優於修正劍橋模型。

sentences.english: Lighthill, J. Waves in Fluids. Cambridge University Press, 1978.
sentences.chinese: 《流體中的波》，劍橋大學出版社，1978年。

sentences.english: He rowed No.8 in the Cambridge crew.
sentences.chinese: 他是劍橋大學划船隊的8號劃手。

sentences.english: She has a grown-up son, several grandchildren and lives in Cambridge.
sentences.chinese: 她有一個成年的兒子，孫子和幾個在劍橋的生活。

sentences.english: Freeland earned his Ph. D. in evolutionary theory at the University of Cambridge.
sentences.chinese: 傅利蘭在英國劍橋大學取得博士學位，主攻演化理論。

sentences.english: Papers are sent to UCLES for marking.
sentences.chinese: 試卷被送往劍橋大學考試委員會打分。

sentences.english: Yes, I suppose Cambridge is a quiet place. Where did you live when you first arrived?
sentences.chinese: 我想劍橋是一個安靜的地方。你剛來住在哪？

sentences.english: Fergus won a scholarship to Cambridge.
sentences.chinese: 弗格斯獲得了上劍橋大學的獎學金。

sentences.english: Sebastian graduated from the University of Cambridge with a MA degree in Engineering.
sentences.chinese: 陳頌銘先生畢業於劍橋大學，獲工程碩士學位。

sentences.english: Cambridge University provides opportunities for academic achievement which are probab1y unequalled.
sentences.chinese: 劍橋大學爲水平不一的有識之士提供學術研究的機會。

sentences.english: The Cambridge University rows against Oxford every year.
sentences.chinese: 劍橋大學每年與牛津大學進行划船比賽。

sentences.english: Miriam mand I want to congratulate The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge on the birth of their son.
sentences.chinese: 米里亞姆和我想要祝賀劍橋公爵夫婦喜得貴子。

sentences.english: In an enlightened move, Oxford and Cambridge dropped these general entrance exams.
sentences.chinese: 牛津和劍橋曾經放棄過這種一般入學考試。

sentences.english: People always go into raptures at the mere mention of Oxbridge.
sentences.chinese: 人們只要一提到牛津劍橋大學就會很興奮。

definition: the Great Learning, one of the Four Books 四書|四书[Si4 shu1] in Confucianism
